com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE


  • public interface INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getSupplyCorrections(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE user exit is called when there is a need to customize the Supply details.

    • Method Detail

      • getSupplyCorrections

        org.w3c.dom.Document getSupplyCorrections(YFSEnvironment env,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                   throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE user exit is called when there is a need to customize the Supply details. OrderReference will contain OrderHeaderKey, so that supplies can be adjusted based on order information. Some of the supplies can be hidden during availability inquiry for specific orders using the OrderReference attribute. This field will be populated only when called with a context of an order such as scheduleOrder. Whenever inventory is read from the inventory layer - either external (getExternalSuppliesUE) or internal, getSupplyCorrectionsUE will be called on all supplies that will be considered. This UE will be able to adjust corresponding supplies - add new supplies (only with the same node and item as the input), remove existing supplies, modify all supply properties (under Supply element). Even the supplies that are marked as infinite will be provided in the user exit input. Only supplies that are returned from this user exit will be used for matching against demands. So if output is empty, it will be assumed that no supplies are available.

        The input and output XML formats support processing of multiple items at once. This is for future use only as the user exit will be invoked for one item at a time in the current release. Inventory item information along with a list of supplies and their corresponding tags will be passed out to the user exit. Nodes, which are on hold for scheduling, will not be passed out in the input XML. Only the Supply Element is template controlled in this User Exit.

        Supply information of the item is expected in the output xml. It is expected that the user exit would return back the correct supply picture as there will be no validation done on the returned output of the user exit.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: None.

        Post-conditions: None.

        Additional Information: User exit is called for all organizations having Inventory Organization Relationship with Inventory Organization of order and its consumable Inventory Organization.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - contains the information for which inventory is required. For more information, see the associated input files.


        Returns:
        An XML document that contains inventory supply information. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
